newsitem.title: GERMANY: Germany's NA unaffected by Ok Tedi mill shut-down.
newsitem.headline: Germany's NA unaffected by Ok Tedi mill shut-down.

text.p: A raw materials source at Germany's copper producer Norddeutsche Affinerie (NA) said NA had not experienced any concentrate supply problems after a grinding mill shut-down at Ok Tedi, one of its suppliers.
Ok Tedi operator Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd (BHP) said on Monday it had shut a second mill after a similar move last week because drought hampered vital ship movements on the Fly River.
Ok Tedi accounted for some 90,000 tonnes of concentrates out of the 700,000 tonnes bought annually by NA, the source said.
Temporary delays from this source were no problem because NA's raw materials cover was generally good.
It was more conceivable problems would occur in other countries such as Japan, where roughly 50 percent of Ok Tedi's output was headed, South Korea and Finland.
NA is Germany's only integrated copper smelter and can vary its intake between ore and scrap, where markets were also well supplied.
In 1995/96 (Oct/Sept), NA produced 368,958 tonnes of cathodes, 109,950 tonnes of copper semis and 227,940 tonnes of copper rod.
